nodes.Description:
CWE-363: Race Condition Enabling Link Following
The product checks the status of a file or directory before accessing it, which produces a race condition in which the file can be replaced with a link before the access is performed, causing the product to access the wrong file.
nodes.label: Race Condition Enabling Link Following

nodes.Description:
CWE-820: Missing Synchronization
The product utilizes a shared resource in a concurrent manner but does not attempt to synchronize access to the resource.
nodes.label: Missing Synchronization

nodes.Description:
CWE-1058: Invokable Control Element in Multi-Thread Context with non-Final Static Storable or Member Element
The code contains a function or method that operates in a multi-threaded environment but owns an unsafe non-final static storable or member data element.
nodes.label: Invokable Control Element in Multi-Thread Context with non-Final Static Storable or Member Element

nodes.Description:
CWE-1233: Security-Sensitive Hardware Controls with Missing Lock Bit Protection
The product uses a register lock bit protection mechanism, but it does not ensure that the lock bit prevents modification of system registers or controls that perform changes to important hardware system configuration.
nodes.label: Security-Sensitive Hardware Controls with Missing Lock Bit Protection

nodes.Description:
CWE-705: Incorrect Control Flow Scoping
The product does not properly return control flow to the proper location after it has completed a task or detected an unusual condition.
nodes.label: Incorrect Control Flow Scoping

nodes.Description:
CWE-691: Insufficient Control Flow Management
The code does not sufficiently manage its control flow during execution, creating conditions in which the control flow can be modified in unexpected ways.
nodes.label: Insufficient Control Flow Management

nodes.Description:
CWE-617: Reachable Assertion
The product contains an assert() or similar statement that can be triggered by an attacker, which leads to an application exit or other behavior that is more severe than necessary.
nodes.label: Reachable Assertion

nodes.Description:
CWE-662: Improper Synchronization
The product utilizes multiple threads or processes to allow temporary access to a shared resource that can only be exclusive to one process at a time, but it does not properly synchronize these actions, which might cause simultaneous accesses of this resource by multiple threads or processes.
nodes.label: Improper Synchronization

nodes.Description:
CWE-833: Deadlock
The product contains multiple threads or executable segments that are waiting for each other to release a necessary lock, resulting in deadlock.
nodes.label: Deadlock

nodes.Description:
CWE-600: Uncaught Exception in Servlet
The Servlet does not catch all exceptions, which may reveal sensitive debugging information.
nodes.label: Uncaught Exception in Servlet

nodes.Description:
CWE-1298: Hardware Logic Contains Race Conditions
A race condition in the hardware logic results in undermining security guarantees of the system.
nodes.label: Hardware Logic Contains Race Conditions

nodes.Description:
CWE-397: Declaration of Throws for Generic Exception
Throwing overly broad exceptions promotes complex error handling code that is more likely to contain security vulnerabilities.
nodes.label: Declaration of Throws for Generic Exception

nodes.Description:
CWE-835: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
The product contains an iteration or loop with an exit condition that cannot be reached, i.e., an infinite loop.
nodes.label: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

nodes.Description:
CWE-799: Improper Control of Interaction Frequency
The product does not properly limit the number or frequency of interactions that it has with an actor, such as the number of incoming requests.
nodes.label: Improper Control of Interaction Frequency

nodes.Description:
CWE-821: Incorrect Synchronization
The product utilizes a shared resource in a concurrent manner, but it does not correctly synchronize access to the resource.
nodes.label: Incorrect Synchronization

nodes.Description:
CWE-1088: Synchronous Access of Remote Resource without Timeout
The code has a synchronous call to a remote resource, but there is no timeout for the call, or the timeout is set to infinite.
nodes.label: Synchronous Access of Remote Resource without Timeout

nodes.Description:
CWE-364: Signal Handler Race Condition
The product uses a signal handler that introduces a race condition.
nodes.label: Signal Handler Race Condition

nodes.Description:
CWE-574: EJB Bad Practices: Use of Synchronization Primitives
The product violates the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification by using thread synchronization primitives.
nodes.label: EJB Bad Practices: Use of Synchronization Primitives

nodes.Description:
CWE-696: Incorrect Behavior Order
The product performs multiple related behaviors, but the behaviors are performed in the wrong order in ways which may produce resultant weaknesses.
nodes.label: Incorrect Behavior Order

nodes.Description:
CWE-1190: DMA Device Enabled Too Early in Boot Phase
The product enables a Direct Memory Access (DMA) capable device before the security configuration settings are established, which allows an attacker to extract data from or gain privileges on the product.
nodes.label: DMA Device Enabled Too Early in Boot Phase

nodes.Description:
CWE-543: Use of Singleton Pattern Without Synchronization in a Multithreaded Context
The product uses the singleton pattern when creating a resource within a multithreaded environment.
nodes.label: Use of Singleton Pattern Without Synchronization in a Multithreaded Context

nodes.Description:
CWE-367: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition
The product checks the state of a resource before using that resource, but the resource's state can change between the check and the use in a way that invalidates the results of the check. This can cause the product to perform invalid actions when the resource is in an unexpected state.
nodes.label: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition

nodes.Description:
CWE-1279: Cryptographic Operations are run Before Supporting Units are Ready
Performing cryptographic operations without ensuring that the supporting inputs are ready to supply valid data may compromise the cryptographic result.
nodes.label: Cryptographic Operations are run Before Supporting Units are Ready

nodes.Description:
CWE-558: Use of getlogin() in Multithreaded Application
The product uses the getlogin() function in a multithreaded context, potentially causing it to return incorrect values.
nodes.label: Use of getlogin() in Multithreaded Application

nodes.Description:
CWE-179: Incorrect Behavior Order: Early Validation
The product validates input before applying protection mechanisms that modify the input, which could allow an attacker to bypass the validation via dangerous inputs that only arise after the modification.
nodes.label: Incorrect Behavior Order: Early Validation

nodes.Description:
CWE-1232: Improper Lock Behavior After Power State Transition
Register lock bit protection disables changes to system configuration once the bit is set. Some of the protected registers or lock bits become programmable after power state transitions (e.g., Entry and wake from low power sleep modes) causing the system configuration to be changeable.
nodes.label: Improper Lock Behavior After Power State Transition

nodes.Description:
CWE-1223: Race Condition for Write-Once Attributes
A write-once register in hardware design is programmable by an untrusted software component earlier than the trusted software component, resulting in a race condition issue.
nodes.label: Race Condition for Write-Once Attributes

nodes.Description:
CWE-414: Missing Lock Check
A product does not check to see if a lock is present before performing sensitive operations on a resource.
nodes.label: Missing Lock Check

nodes.Description:
CWE-1264: Hardware Logic with Insecure De-Synchronization between Control and Data Channels
The hardware logic for error handling and security checks can incorrectly forward data before the security check is complete.
nodes.label: Hardware Logic with Insecure De-Synchronization between Control and Data Channels

nodes.Description:
CWE-455: Non-exit on Failed Initialization
The product does not exit or otherwise modify its operation when security-relevant errors occur during initialization, such as when a configuration file has a format error or a hardware security module (HSM) cannot be activated, which can cause the product to execute in a less secure fashion than intended by the administrator.
nodes.label: Non-exit on Failed Initialization

nodes.Description:
CWE-776: Improper Restriction of Recursive Entity References in DTDs ('XML Entity Expansion')
The product uses XML documents and allows their structure to be defined with a Document Type Definition (DTD), but it does not properly control the number of recursive definitions of entities.
nodes.label: Improper Restriction of Recursive Entity References in DTDs ('XML Entity Expansion')

nodes.Description:
CWE-421: Race Condition During Access to Alternate Channel
The product opens an alternate channel to communicate with an authorized user, but the channel is accessible to other actors.
nodes.label: Race Condition During Access to Alternate Channel

nodes.Description:
CWE-1280: Access Control Check Implemented After Asset is Accessed
A product's hardware-based access control check occurs after the asset has been accessed.
nodes.label: Access Control Check Implemented After Asset is Accessed

nodes.Description:
CWE-368: Context Switching Race Condition
A product performs a series of non-atomic actions to switch between contexts that cross privilege or other security boundaries, but a race condition allows an attacker to modify or misrepresent the product's behavior during the switch.
nodes.label: Context Switching Race Condition

nodes.Description:
CWE-484: Omitted Break Statement in Switch
The product omits a break statement within a switch or similar construct, causing code associated with multiple conditions to execute. This can cause problems when the programmer only intended to execute code associated with one condition.
nodes.label: Omitted Break Statement in Switch

nodes.Description:
CWE-1281: Sequence of Processor Instructions Leads to Unexpected Behavior
Specific combinations of processor instructions lead to undesirable behavior such as locking the processor until a hard reset performed.
nodes.label: Sequence of Processor Instructions Leads to Unexpected Behavior

nodes.Description:
CWE-591: Sensitive Data Storage in Improperly Locked Memory
The product stores sensitive data in memory that is not locked, or that has been incorrectly locked, which might cause the memory to be written to swap files on disk by the virtual memory manager. This can make the data more accessible to external actors.
nodes.label: Sensitive Data Storage in Improperly Locked Memory

nodes.Description:
CWE-832: Unlock of a Resource that is not Locked
The product attempts to unlock a resource that is not locked.
nodes.label: Unlock of a Resource that is not Locked

nodes.Description:
CWE-841: Improper Enforcement of Behavioral Workflow
The product supports a session in which more than one behavior must be performed by an actor, but it does not properly ensure that the actor performs the behaviors in the required sequence.
nodes.label: Improper Enforcement of Behavioral Workflow

nodes.Description:
CWE-609: Double-Checked Locking
The product uses double-checked locking to access a resource without the overhead of explicit synchronization, but the locking is insufficient.
nodes.label: Double-Checked Locking

nodes.Description:
CWE-551: Incorrect Behavior Order: Authorization Before Parsing and Canonicalization
If a web server does not fully parse requested URLs before it examines them for authorization, it may be possible for an attacker to bypass authorization protection.
nodes.label: Incorrect Behavior Order: Authorization Before Parsing and Canonicalization

nodes.Description:
CWE-837: Improper Enforcement of a Single, Unique Action
The product requires that an actor should only be able to perform an action once, or to have only one unique action, but the product does not enforce or improperly enforces this restriction.
nodes.label: Improper Enforcement of a Single, Unique Action

nodes.Description:
CWE-366: Race Condition within a Thread
If two threads of execution use a resource simultaneously, there exists the possibility that resources may be used while invalid, in turn making the state of execution undefined.
nodes.label: Race Condition within a Thread

nodes.Description:
CWE-480: Use of Incorrect Operator
The product accidentally uses the wrong operator, which changes the logic in security-relevant ways.
nodes.label: Use of Incorrect Operator

nodes.Description:
CWE-567: Unsynchronized Access to Shared Data in a Multithreaded Context
The product does not properly synchronize shared data, such as static variables across threads, which can lead to undefined behavior and unpredictable data changes.
nodes.label: Unsynchronized Access to Shared Data in a Multithreaded Context

nodes.Description:
CWE-479: Signal Handler Use of a Non-reentrant Function
The product defines a signal handler that calls a non-reentrant function.
nodes.label: Signal Handler Use of a Non-reentrant Function

nodes.Description:
CWE-481: Assigning instead of Comparing
The code uses an operator for assignment when the intention was to perform a comparison.
nodes.label: Assigning instead of Comparing

nodes.Description:
CWE-396: Declaration of Catch for Generic Exception
Catching overly broad exceptions promotes complex error handling code that is more likely to contain security vulnerabilities.
nodes.label: Declaration of Catch for Generic Exception

nodes.Description:
CWE-783: Operator Precedence Logic Error
The product uses an expression in which operator precedence causes incorrect logic to be used.
nodes.label: Operator Precedence Logic Error

nodes.Description:
CWE-667: Improper Locking
The product does not properly acquire or release a lock on a resource, leading to unexpected resource state changes and behaviors.
nodes.label: Improper Locking

nodes.Description:
CWE-1193: Power-On of Untrusted Execution Core Before Enabling Fabric Access Control
The product enables components that contain untrusted firmware before memory and fabric access controls have been enabled.
nodes.label: Power-On of Untrusted Execution Core Before Enabling Fabric Access Control

nodes.Description:
CWE-834: Excessive Iteration
The product performs an iteration or loop without sufficiently limiting the number of times that the loop is executed.
nodes.label: Excessive Iteration

nodes.Description:
CWE-698: Execution After Redirect (EAR)
The web application sends a redirect to another location, but instead of exiting, it executes additional code.
nodes.label: Execution After Redirect (EAR)

nodes.Description:
CWE-362: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')
The product contains a code sequence that can run concurrently with other code, and the code sequence requires temporary, exclusive access to a shared resource, but a timing window exists in which the shared resource can be modified by another code sequence that is operating concurrently.
nodes.label: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')

nodes.Description:
CWE-670: Always-Incorrect Control Flow Implementation
The code contains a control flow path that does not reflect the algorithm that the path is intended to implement, leading to incorrect behavior any time this path is navigated.
nodes.label: Always-Incorrect Control Flow Implementation

nodes.Description:
CWE-307: Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts
The product does not implement sufficient measures to prevent multiple failed authentication attempts within a short time frame, making it more susceptible to brute force attacks.
nodes.label: Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts

nodes.Description:
CWE-482: Comparing instead of Assigning
The code uses an operator for comparison when the intention was to perform an assignment.
nodes.label: Comparing instead of Assigning

nodes.Description:
CWE-248: Uncaught Exception
An exception is thrown from a function, but it is not caught.
nodes.label: Uncaught Exception

nodes.Description:
CWE-412: Unrestricted Externally Accessible Lock
The product properly checks for the existence of a lock, but the lock can be externally controlled or influenced by an actor that is outside of the intended sphere of control.
nodes.label: Unrestricted Externally Accessible Lock

nodes.Description:
CWE-431: Missing Handler
A handler is not available or implemented.
nodes.label: Missing Handler

nodes.Description:
CWE-483: Incorrect Block Delimitation
The code does not explicitly delimit a block that is intended to contain 2 or more statements, creating a logic error.
nodes.label: Incorrect Block Delimitation

nodes.Description:
CWE-831: Signal Handler Function Associated with Multiple Signals
The product defines a function that is used as a handler for more than one signal.
nodes.label: Signal Handler Function Associated with Multiple Signals

nodes.Description:
CWE-768: Incorrect Short Circuit Evaluation
The product contains a conditional statement with multiple logical expressions in which one of the non-leading expressions may produce side effects. This may lead to an unexpected state in the program after the execution of the conditional, because short-circuiting logic may prevent the side effects from occurring.
nodes.label: Incorrect Short Circuit Evaluation

nodes.Description:
CWE-663: Use of a Non-reentrant Function in a Concurrent Context
The product calls a non-reentrant function in a concurrent context in which a competing code sequence (e.g. thread or signal handler) may have an opportunity to call the same function or otherwise influence its state.
nodes.label: Use of a Non-reentrant Function in a Concurrent Context

nodes.Description:
CWE-395: Use of NullPointerException Catch to Detect NULL Pointer Dereference
Catching NullPointerException should not be used as an alternative to programmatic checks to prevent dereferencing a null pointer.
nodes.label: Use of NullPointerException Catch to Detect NULL Pointer Dereference

nodes.Description:
CWE-180: Incorrect Behavior Order: Validate Before Canonicalize
The product validates input before it is canonicalized, which prevents the product from detecting data that becomes invalid after the canonicalization step.
nodes.label: Incorrect Behavior Order: Validate Before Canonicalize

nodes.Description:
CWE-432: Dangerous Signal Handler not Disabled During Sensitive Operations
The product uses a signal handler that shares state with other signal handlers, but it does not properly mask or prevent those signal handlers from being invoked while the original signal handler is still running.
nodes.label: Dangerous Signal Handler not Disabled During Sensitive Operations

nodes.Description:
CWE-674: Uncontrolled Recursion
The product does not properly control the amount of recursion that takes place, consuming excessive resources, such as allocated memory or the program stack.
nodes.label: Uncontrolled Recursion

nodes.Description:
CWE-765: Multiple Unlocks of a Critical Resource
The product unlocks a critical resource more times than intended, leading to an unexpected state in the system.
nodes.label: Multiple Unlocks of a Critical Resource

nodes.Description:
CWE-572: Call to Thread run() instead of start()
The product calls a thread's run() method instead of calling start(), which causes the code to run in the thread of the caller instead of the callee.
nodes.label: Call to Thread run() instead of start()

nodes.Description:
CWE-1234: Hardware Internal or Debug Modes Allow Override of Locks
System configuration protection may be bypassed during debug mode.
nodes.label: Hardware Internal or Debug Modes Allow Override of Locks

nodes.Description:
CWE-1096: Singleton Class Instance Creation without Proper Locking or Synchronization
The product implements a Singleton design pattern but does not use appropriate locking or other synchronization mechanism to ensure that the singleton class is only instantiated once.
nodes.label: Singleton Class Instance Creation without Proper Locking or Synchronization

nodes.Description:
CWE-584: Return Inside Finally Block
The code has a return statement inside a finally block, which will cause any thrown exception in the try block to be discarded.
nodes.label: Return Inside Finally Block

nodes.Description:
CWE-1322: Use of Blocking Code in Single-threaded, Non-blocking Context
The product uses a non-blocking model that relies on a single threaded process for features such as scalability, but it contains code that can block when it is invoked.
nodes.label: Use of Blocking Code in Single-threaded, Non-blocking Context

nodes.Description:
CWE-828: Signal Handler with Functionality that is not Asynchronous-Safe
The product defines a signal handler that contains code sequences that are not asynchronous-safe, i.e., the functionality is not reentrant, or it can be interrupted.
nodes.label: Signal Handler with Functionality that is not Asynchronous-Safe

nodes.Description:
CWE-1265: Unintended Reentrant Invocation of Non-reentrant Code Via Nested Calls
During execution of non-reentrant code, the product performs a call that unintentionally produces a nested invocation of the non-reentrant code.
nodes.label: Unintended Reentrant Invocation of Non-reentrant Code Via Nested Calls

nodes.Description:
CWE-408: Incorrect Behavior Order: Early Amplification
The product allows an entity to perform a legitimate but expensive operation before authentication or authorization has taken place.
nodes.label: Incorrect Behavior Order: Early Amplification

nodes.Description:
CWE-430: Deployment of Wrong Handler
The wrong "handler" is assigned to process an object.
nodes.label: Deployment of Wrong Handler

nodes.Description:
CWE-689: Permission Race Condition During Resource Copy
The product, while copying or cloning a resource, does not set the resource's permissions or access control until the copy is complete, leaving the resource exposed to other spheres while the copy is taking place.
nodes.label: Permission Race Condition During Resource Copy

nodes.Description:
CWE-597: Use of Wrong Operator in String Comparison
The product uses the wrong operator when comparing a string, such as using "==" when the .equals() method should be used instead.
nodes.label: Use of Wrong Operator in String Comparison

nodes.Description:
CWE-382: J2EE Bad Practices: Use of System.exit()
A J2EE application uses System.exit(), which also shuts down its container.
nodes.label: J2EE Bad Practices: Use of System.exit()

nodes.Description:
CWE-764: Multiple Locks of a Critical Resource
The product locks a critical resource more times than intended, leading to an unexpected state in the system.
nodes.label: Multiple Locks of a Critical Resource

nodes.Description:
CWE-413: Improper Resource Locking
The product does not lock or does not correctly lock a resource when the product must have exclusive access to the resource.
nodes.label: Improper Resource Locking

nodes.Description:
CWE-181: Incorrect Behavior Order: Validate Before Filter
The product validates data before it has been filtered, which prevents the product from detecting data that becomes invalid after the filtering step.
nodes.label: Incorrect Behavior Order: Validate Before Filter
